title: The twists and turns of Trump's military strategy
subhead: Venezuela, Greenland, Iran... Behind Donald Trump's martial rhetoric, Washington has forged a strategy of targeted strikes and simultaneous operations, running the risk of stretching its military capabilities too thin.

title: Macron says France to send more forces to Greenland
Denmark and Greenland hit Trump administration's intransigence
Macron's party endorses Sarkozy's son in Riviera election, dividing members
subhead: Louis Sarkozy, the son of former president Nicolas Sarkozy, is running for mayor in Menton. He said he would be 'ready to work with' far-right parties, before attempting to recant.

title: Moldovan president backs unification with Romania
subhead: Moldovan President Maia Sandu's unprecedented stance among the country's top leaders aims to highlight Chisinau's European orientation and to urge Brussels to accelerate the process for Moldova – Ukraine's neighbor – to join the European Union amid ongoing Russian interference and internal vulnerabilities.

title: How Gianni Infantino's pay quadrupled in 10 years as head of FIFA
subhead: According to US tax documents seen by Le Monde, football's global governing body paid its president a little over $6 million in 2024.

title: 'India and Europe are discovering new geostrategic affinities, an example of realignment amid global chaos'
subhead: The warming of relations between Europe and the world's most populous country reflects a counter-strategy to the hostility of the Trump administration, writes Le Monde's columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: US sanctions Iranian officials over crackdown on protests
Greenlanders overwhelmed by Trump's ambitions: '$10,000 to annex the island, who does he think we are?'
French Olympic champion Yannick Agnel to stand trial on rape charges
Uganda's veteran guerrilla, Yoweri Museveni, seeks a seventh term
Trump threatens to invoke Insurrection Act in Minnesota
'In the face of Trump's imperialism, realism means defending the law as an indispensable tool'
Behind France's declining birthrate, the complex question of wanting children
France's government survives no-confidence votes as budget deadlock deepens
Gaza racked by uncertainty about 'second phase' of Trump's ceasefire plan
A rare 16th-century drawing by the master Hans Baldung Grien auctioned in Paris
Inside Dubai's unprecedented seizure of drug traffickers' real estate assets
West Bank's Birzeit University still reeling one week after Israeli army fired on students
After celebrating Maduro ouster, Venezuelan migrants in US fear what lies ahead
subhead: After celebrating the abduction of Nicolas Maduro, Venezuelan asylum seekers in the US have begun to have doubts. In Denver, Colorado, where they number in the tens of thousands, many now fear having to go back to their country with the Chavistas still in power.

title: Reza Pahlavi, the son of Iran's shah fanning the flames of revolt
subhead: The son of Iran's former monarch, driven out of the country by the 1979 Islamic Revolution, has repeatedly called for protests against the Tehran regime. Crowds chant his name, and from his US exile, he has increasingly positioned himself as a leader of the movement.

title: How France's fixation with decline serves the Trumpian narrative
subhead: As the threat posed by the United States grows, narratives of decline have gained traction in France, setting the stage for a presidential campaign centered on the power of France and Europe.

title: President Trump, Greenland does not want to become American
'Instead of commenting on the unthinkable, Europeans should take action in Greenland'
'Corporate America is crushing the planet with its profits'
